data.title: Slim SAT
data.statement:
You are given a logical formula with <<one free variable>>. The formula is made up of <<logical operations>> (e.g., {{AND}}) and <<variables>> (labeled with capital letters). Additionally, each logical operation is surrounded by <<parentheses>> '{{(}}...{{)}}'.

All but one present variable [[X]] is assigned a fixed truth value in the input. Your job is to determine whether the given formula can be made true by assigning either {{TRUE}} or {{FALSE}} to [[X]].

testCases.title: A simple one
testCases.testIn:
( A AND ( A OR X ) )
1
A TRUE

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
( A AND ( X OR A ) )
1
A TRUE

testCases.title: Slightly bigger formula
testCases.testIn:
( ( X AND ( A OR A ) ) XOR ( A AND X ) )
1
A TRUE

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn:
( ( A AND ( X OR A ) ) XOR ( X AND X ) )
1
A TRUE

testCases.title: More variables
testCases.testIn:
( ( X OR Y ) XOR ( ( B AND X ) OR ( A AND X ) ) )
3
A FALSE
B FALSE
Y FALSE

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
( ( X OR Y ) XOR ( ( B AND X ) OR ( A AND X ) ) )
3
A FALSE
B TRUE
Y FALSE

testCases.title: Even bigger formula
testCases.testIn:
( ( ( ( X XOR U ) AND ( E OR X ) ) AND ( T AND R ) ) XOR ( ( X OR T ) OR ( R XOR ( ( U OR E ) AND E ) ) ) )
4
T TRUE
R FALSE
U TRUE
E FALSE

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
( ( ( ( X XOR U ) AND ( E OR X ) ) AND ( T AND R ) ) XOR ( ( X OR T ) OR ( R XOR ( ( U OR E ) AND E ) ) ) )
4
T FALSE
R TRUE
U FALSE
E TRUE

testCases.title: Huge formula
testCases.testIn:
( ( ( A AND ( X XOR ( X AND ( ( X AND D ) OR ( A XOR X ) ) ) ) ) OR ( A XOR ( B OR D ) ) ) AND ( ( C OR ( ( A OR X ) AND ( ( X XOR ( B AND X ) ) OR X ) ) ) XOR ( X XOR X ) ) )
4
A FALSE
B TRUE
C FALSE
D FALSE

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn:
( ( ( A AND ( X XOR ( X AND ( ( X AND D ) OR ( A XOR X ) ) ) ) ) OR ( B XOR ( A OR D ) ) ) AND ( ( C OR ( ( A OR X ) AND ( ( X XOR ( B AND X ) ) OR X ) ) ) XOR ( X XOR X ) ) )
4
A FALSE
B FALSE
C TRUE
D FALSE

testCases.title: Many variables
testCases.testIn:
( ( ( ( ( L AND ( X XOR ( N OR ( J AND ( ( V AND ( ( E OR ( X XOR ( V AND ( ( H OR ( X AND T ) ) OR Q ) ) ) ) AND D ) ) XOR M ) ) ) ) ) OR ( ( P AND W ) XOR L ) ) AND ( K OR ( A OR ( X OR B ) ) ) ) OR ( Z XOR ( C AND ( F XOR ( C OR ( X AND ( ( ( U XOR G ) AND ( ( O OR R ) OR I ) ) OR X ) ) ) ) ) ) ) AND ( S AND Y ) )
25
A TRUE
B FALSE
C FALSE
D FALSE
E TRUE
F FALSE
G FALSE
H TRUE
I TRUE
J FALSE
K FALSE
L TRUE
M FALSE
N FALSE
O FALSE
P TRUE
Q FALSE
R FALSE
S TRUE
T FALSE
U TRUE
V FALSE
W TRUE
Y TRUE
Z FALSE

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testIn:
( ( ( ( ( L AND ( X XOR ( N OR ( J AND ( ( V AND ( ( E OR ( X XOR ( V AND ( ( H OR ( X AND T ) ) OR Q ) ) ) ) AND D ) ) XOR M ) ) ) ) ) OR ( ( W AND P ) XOR L ) ) AND ( K OR ( A OR ( B OR X ) ) ) ) OR ( Z XOR ( C AND ( F XOR ( C OR ( X AND ( ( ( U XOR G ) AND ( ( O OR R ) OR I ) ) OR X ) ) ) ) ) ) ) AND ( S AND Y ) )
25
A FALSE
B TRUE
C FALSE
D FALSE
E FALSE
F TRUE
G FALSE
H TRUE
I TRUE
J FALSE
K FALSE
L TRUE
M FALSE
N FALSE
O TRUE
P FALSE
Q FALSE
R FALSE
S TRUE
T FALSE
U TRUE
V TRUE
W FALSE
Y TRUE
Z FALSE

data.constraints:
0 <= [[N]] <= 25
length([[formula]]) <= 1000
Logical variables are capital letters  <<A,B,C,...,Z>>.
The free variable is always denoted [[X]].

The formula is syntactically correct and fully parenthesized.
data.stubGenerator:
read formula:string(1000)
read n:int
loop n read name:word(1) value:word(5)
write Can it be done?
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[formula]] a string consisting of space-separated letters, logical words or parentheses.
<<Line 2:>> [[N]] the number of <<fixed>> logical variables
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Space-separated pairs [[A]] [[value]] with variable name [[A]] and truth value [[value]] either {{TRUE}} or {{FALSE}}.

The formula uses only the following logical expressions: {{AND}}, {{OR}}, {{XOR}}, where {{XOR}} denotes "exclusive or" which is true only if exactly one input is true (and not both).
data.outputDescription: If the free variable [[X]] can be assigned a truth value to make the entire formula true, then return {{Satisfiable}}, otherwise return {{Unsatisfiable}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given a logical formula with one free variable. The formula is made up of logical operations (e.g., AND) and variables (labeled with capital letters). Additionally, each logical operation is surrounded by parentheses '(...)'.

All but one present variable X is assigned a fixed truth value in the input. Your job is to determine whether the given formula can be made true by assigning either TRUE or FALSE to X.
Input
Line 1: formula a string consisting of space-separated letters, logical words or parentheses.
Line 2: N the number of fixed logical variables
Next N lines: Space-separated pairs A value with variable name A and truth value value either TRUE or FALSE.

The formula uses only the following logical expressions: AND, OR, XOR, where XOR denotes "exclusive or" which is true only if exactly one input is true (and not both).
Output
If the free variable X can be assigned a truth value to make the entire formula true, then return Satisfiable, otherwise return Unsatisfiable.
Constraints
0 <= N <= 25
length(formula) <= 1000
Logical variables are capital letters A,B,C,...,Z.
The free variable is always denoted X.

The formula is syntactically correct and fully parenthesized.
Example
Input
( A AND ( A OR X ) )
1
A TRUE
Output
Satisfiable
